text: March 27, 2008 - Murtha Addresses JARI Meeting
label: TITLE

text: Daily American
label: BODY

text: http://www.dailyamerican.com/
label: BODY

text: Murtha addresses JARI meeting
label: BODY

text: By SANDY WOJCIK
label: BODY

text: March 27, 2008
label: BODY

text: Rep. John P. Murtha, D-Johnstown, addressed business leaders, entrepreneurs, economic development officers and
label: BODY

text: elected officials from across Cambria and Somerset counties Monday at the Johnstown Area Regional Industries (JARI)
label: BODY

text: annual report meeting.
label: BODY

text: The meeting was held at the Holiday Inn in Johnstown and more than 110 attended. Murtha said in an interview, before
label: BODY

text: serving as the keynote speaker, that he was excited about what was taking place in Cambria and Somerset counties.
label: BODY

text: “Thirty years ago we saw all kinds of problems in employment — the steel mills which were such a bonus
label: BODY

text: for us, but on the other hand they were closing down and we knew we had to diversify to attract not only the older people
label: BODY

text: but the younger people,” he said.
label: BODY

text: Murtha said he feels that through organizations such as JARI much has been accomplished, from improving the
label: BODY

text: infrastructure to cleaning up the streams.
label: BODY

text: “I think that is what we have done. People forget as much as we liked the steel mills, they were shut down for
label: BODY

text: much of the time with layoffs and strikes,” he said.
label: BODY

text: He said businesses like to come to this area because of the quality of life and work ethnic.
label: BODY

text: Regional momentum was a central theme of Monday’s meeting, which also focused on JARI’s
label: BODY

text: commitment to the community and the results that come from its team approach to business development. To highlight
label: BODY

text: that fact, a fast-paced 60-second video was shown featuring images from several local companies.
label: BODY

text: “You can see the momentum we built up here with the transportation and the showcases, which puts it all
label: BODY

text: together,” said Murtha. “ We’re working on 219 south to see if we can get that going. This all ties
label: BODY

text: together. Jari has done such a good job in tying it all together. There’s an energy, which I see, which transcends
label: BODY

text: the age. Everything builds on it. It’s a long process, and it takes a lot of coordination and JARI is a big part.”
label: BODY

text: The Online Office of Congressman John Murtha
label: BODY

text: http://www.murtha.house.gov
label: BODY

text: Powered by Joomla!
label: BODY

text: Generated: 2 February, 2010, 17:11
label: BODY

text: Linda Thomson, the president of JARI, said there is a strong momentum going in this area. “Young people today
label: BODY

text: have a lot of options in the region. In Cambria and Somerset Counties both, there are a lot of opportunities in specific
label: BODY

text: skills and disciplines. We encourage people to look at what the future holds for certain type of jobs in the region.”
label: BODY

text: Thomson said the area offers jobs in computers, health care, welding and machining.
label: BODY

text: “There are loads of opportunities, you just have to look beneath the surface a bit,” she said. “These
label: BODY

text: are very exciting times, the most excitement I have seen since I became involved in JARI eight years ago.”
label: BODY

text: Thomson said seeing the momentum in the region is important to young people. She explained that JARI has been
label: BODY

text: working to get a consortium into the schools to talk to the students about what job opportunities are out there.
label: BODY

text: In addition, Thomson said JARI efforts helped make the 2007 Showcase for Commerce the most well attended event of
label: BODY

text: its 17-year history. More key decision-makers and procurement officers that are employed by prime contractors and the
label: BODY

text: federal government came than ever before.
label: BODY

text: “We understand the regional economy is really key to the quality and vitality of life in both Somerset and Cambria
label: BODY

text: counties,” said Somerset County Commissioner Pamela Tokar Ickes. “We’re here today to get the
label: BODY

text: state of the economy message and be a part of the greater efforts in the two-county area. We have a very close working
label: BODY

text: relationship with JARI.”
label: BODY
